title: Typophile Hearts Interns
content:
Typophile is looking for an intern to start immediately.

**You**  
+ Love typography and are in school to receive a BFA or equivalent in design

+ Can communicate well in written English

+ Have a solid grasp of Creative Suite 2 or 3 (Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign. Flash is a plus.)

+ Want real-world experience in a multi-disciplinary design studio

+ Can handle an X-acto without losing blood

**Typophile**  
+ Is an international collaborative community of designers, typographers and type enthusiasts

+ Is operated by Punchcut the San Francisco based user interface design firm

**The internship will require**  
+ Designing, writing about, shipping and fixing Typophile stuff

+ Preparing Jared Benson's hair and wardrobe for tour dates and appearances

+ Preparing for Typophile events

+ Working 2 days or 20 hours a week on-site at Punchcut world headquarters in San Francisco's lovely Union Square

**Interested candidates** should send a cover letter, resume and URL to your work samples to pemberton [at sign] punchcut [dot] com.

TYPOPHILE  
170 Maiden Lane, 3rd Floor  
San Francisco, CA 94108

Typophile is a [Punchcut](http://web.archive.org/web/20111020180317/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Punchcut) brand.
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: If I were a California resident I would jump at this.

Thanks for the great response everyone. We've had several qualified and solid applicants. I hope you don't mind me replying in public as I'm traveling and it's difficult to keep up with email when I'm forced to absorb all the design here in crazy/beautiful/stinky/inspiring/vulgar Amsterdam.
If only Amsterdam weren't such a tourist trap. I lived in Nederland for two years. It was almost like going back to the states every time I visited Amsterdam.
